reviews.text: We stayed here for the first time and it exceeded all expectations. Price $149.00 + $13.00 a night parking. Great location equal easy walking distance from the Wharf or the Aquarium. Lobby was very nice, inside hallways were carpeted and elegant.King size featherbed was great, I would say the room alone was as good as any I have stayed in. Large bathroom and many amenities. Don't miss the hot tub on the roof, robes and towels, and binoculars provided. I guess if I paid $289.00 a night maybe I would be looking for more, but this was great.
reviews.title: Above Expectations
Very comfortable stay...
reviews.text: Also you do not have to shell out for that water front room. We got the park view which also overlooks the bay quite clearly. Staff was friendly and helpful. No problems.

reviews.title: Hated the Health Hazard
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Monterey Bay Inn over Labor Day weekend (September 3-5). I chose it based on tripadvisor reviews, and was completely happy with the choice.

reviews.title: Loved it!!!
reviews.text: The MBI is in a great location- right on Cannery Row within walking distance of nearby beaches and the Aquarium. The front desk was very helpful. We got a harbor view room on the 4th floor.

reviews.title: Monterey Bay Inn -- the best in Monterey!
reviews.text: The rooms at MBI are really comfortable and have a nice decor. There are also a lot of lighting options (several different kinds of lamps both in the room and bathroom, dimmers, etc.), which was nice. The bed was really comfortable, even though it was soft and probably not the best for your back- we slept really well though, to the sound of the ocean crashing against the beach outside. The seagulls and sea lions got raucous at around 7am, but that didn't bother me much. The fountain outside is kind of loud- our room wasn't too close but I could see how previous reviewers thought it was too noisy.
The family and I decided to take a short vacation in Monterey. It would be the first time to Monterey for my sons, ages 3.75 and 9 months.
reviews.title: Not a fan....
A Wonderful Rest
reviews.text: First impressions: Yuck. As we turned left onto Cannery Row, I was feeling less optimistic based upon what I was seeing on the street. The hotel is at the end of Cannery Row and is tucked in beside what appeared to be some sort of commercial operation (warehouse?) I almost missed it as I was expecting a much nicer and grand entrance based upon the rave reviews I read here on this site.

It looked like a motel. The "underground parking" is not really underground. It is really street level, and then the 1st floor rooms are over the parking stalls. It reminds me of a low-end apartment complex or a circa 1970's motel. Quite a let down from a first impression point of view. Self parking is nice, however, as we have two young children and left some stuff in car. We were able to quickly get things that we thought we wouldn't need but did end up using.
reviews.title: Gorgeous rooms!

reviews.text: Check in: Definitely a plus for the hotel. The staff was courteous and friendly.
reviews.title: Take the Top Floor

reviews.text: I loved the sound of the waves off the balcony, I found it very relaxing. We were able to walk to just about everything, the location is great, no need to take the car. One of the best bathrooms I have seen in hotels, large with plenty of lights. A bowl of apples in the lobby was a nice little touch. I grabbed one every day. Staff was friendly and helpful so were the other guests, always saying hello as we passed in the hall. It was away from the noise and crowds so that made it very peaceful. I didn't want to leave. Many fond memories of Monterey!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We stayed at The Monterey Bay Inn this past Thursday. When we were approaching the hotel, I was a little put off by the outward apperance of the hotel. BUT...We were impressed with the lobby, the staff and the room. Even the groundsman was very friendly. Our room had a lovely featherbed, comfy pillows, NICE bathroom, everything!!!! The best part of the stay was that it was extremly quiet. It had a pretty nice view of the harbor, not of the "ocean/harbor" view I paid for. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Don't judge a book by it's cover!!!
Monterey Bay Inn Comments
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed here for 3 nights to enjoy Cannery Row, 17-mile drive, Carmel and the wineries after staying at a quaint B&B in Napa for 4 nights. The hotel location is good -- walking distance to Cannery Row and walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and Coastguard Pier. The front desk was very very helpful! Extremely courteous service always, and I was impressed. Our room was absolutely lovely. Huge bath, nice room, very classy. AND a small balcony that overlooked the ocean with two chairs and a small glass table with a live potted geranium. Very nice touch. Nice amenities with a small continental breakfast served to you each morning. Was on-time each day. I would definitely stay there again, altho is is a bit pricey ($250 + $13 parking). Also, we were not aware that the Bay could make so much noise splashing against the rocks and hotel building...so be aware, it is loud at night when you're trying to sleep (take earplugs). Overall, yes, we'd go back, and it's very very nice!

My wife and I stayed here midweek at the end of June. I had reserved a full bay view room for $225 nite, well in advance. We arrived some what early for check in, but had a friendly greeting and were checked in promptly. To our surprise we were upgraded to a bay view suite. The room was huge. We had a fireplace and sitting area. Nice work desk, wet bar with refrigerator, nice balcony right on top of the water, and a terrific bathroom. The King bed was one of the most comfortable in which I have slept. Overall, there were very nice amenities provided.
reviews.title: Great room, view and service

reviews.text: The front desk sent a complimentary bottle of wine to our room, as they found out we were celebrating a birthday/anniversary. We were on the 4th floor, which had a nice hot tub on the roof overlooking the bay. There was another hot tub on the bottom floor as well.
reviews.title: Great view
Very Nice Place
reviews.text: I read one review talking about the old decaying building next door. This is true, but it didn't matter to us. The location is great because it is a short equal distance walk between Cannery Row shops/Aquarium and Fishermans Wharf/Downtown. The continental breakfast they serve to the room was good and served when you wanted. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. We would stay here again if we ever go back to Monterey.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: Gregg, NJ

The view was fabulous and the sea lions are right outside your window. We even saw dolphins one morning. If you are a lite sleeper the sea life noise may bother you, but we thought it was great and left the siding glass door open. I think any of the oceanview rooms would have a good view. We had a full oceanview king. Very nice room, not large but well appointed and comfortable. There were nice extras in the room like Cds and binoculars. The bathroom was huge with a double vanity. We loved the free breakfast delivered to our room each morning. The location is great also. You are right next to a park at the end of cannery row. I did not think cannery row had much to offer but the hotel is a short walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf which was great. Lots of nice restaurants giving clam chowder samples to try and get you to choose them for dinner. I absolutely recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: You Otter Stay Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night after miscalculating how long it would take to drive from Napa to San Luis Obispo. My husband walked into the inn and asked for a room and bargained it down a bit (it was midweek and late in the day). What a pleasant surprise! The place has obviously been renovated very recently. The bathroom has double sinks and everything was clean, comfortable and modernly stylish. I think most of the rooms have clear ocean views. Ours was a bit closer to the street but still very nice. We slept with the doors a bit ajar at night and could hear the waves pounding and sea lions (seals?). Very nice. We enjoyed the hot tub on the roof that night. Great view of the bay at night and stars overhead. The included breakfast was great as well - definitely better than your usual stale muffin and canned juice. Will definitely go back if we return to Monterey sometime!
reviews.title: Great views, really nice, modern decor.
I miss the sea lions already!
reviews.text: I initially traveled to California on business, but wanted to see more scenic portions of the state. Being a newbie to the California coast travel scene, I had quite a problem trying to find lodgings on such short notice. They fill up quickly during the summer, so be advised. If you want a choice, book early.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fortunately for me, the B & B I eyed early on filled up, and the Monterey Bay Inn was one of my options. I'm so glad it was! I paid more for the room than any other lodging in which I've stayed, but I understood that it was a highly desirable coastal destination at the highest season, and for that you WILL pay a premium.
reviews.title: almost excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked one of the Queen Total Bayview rooms, and I LOVED it. There are sliding doors to the patio, with screens as well, and shutter type doors over the top of those. You can keep the doors open to fully enjoy the sounds of the surf, the seabirds, and the sea lions.
reviews.title: A Perfect Stay
The best!!
reviews.text: The beds are incredibly comfortable, the bathroom well stocked and spacious. I had no problems getting the Hi-Speed internet to work. Simply go to the lobby and get an access code from the desk clerk, and you're all set. Your $10 rate goes from about 12 noon to 12 midnight. Admittedly, most hotels now include Wi-Fi with their rates. A small quibble. I didn't come to Monterey to online surf. I came to WATCH the surf!
